Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seanpaul W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just after renovations were completed in Oct. 2009 with other half for a Birthday Weekend away. Great little hotel, extremely clean, ideal location, great staff, very safe area. Yes, you'll find cheaper but nothing as good as this place. Right beside Champs Elysee and ideal for touring Paris. Also a short few minutes walk from the the Arc the Triomphe, the avenue Montaigne, the Trocadero square and the Eiffel Tower. This 4 star hotel certainly deserves it's stars. Stayed in Superior room for the extra space and the occasion and wasn't disappointed. Would certainly recommend Bassano to anyone travelling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Jack263
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 2 night break in Paris with my two friends. We had a great stay at this hotel, we were in room 60 which was suitable for 3. The room consisted of a room with two single beds and a sofa bed that convert in the living room. The hotel was just a few blocks from the Champs Élysées and the Arc de TrIomphe. I could not recommend this hotel enough. Breakfast was included and it was a lovely buffet selection which set you up for the day. If I had to pick fault it is so minor, the room could have just done with a few more mirrors, the bedroom lacked mirrors and so did the living area. However this was just because we were 3 ladies travelling so we all wanted to get ready at the same time. If I were with my husband it would not have been an issue. I loved the hotel so much I am looking to stay again in August!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: caroline839
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Bassano several times and the welcome and service from the hotel staff has always been top notch. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend the hotel to family and friends and will book to stay here on our next visit to Paris. Caroline, Chelmsford

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite Boutique Hotel near Etoile”
Reviews.Author: boybanker
Reviews.Content: This quiet and discreet, recently renovated hotel is ideal for the business visitor, or for a romantic weekend get-away.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel service”
Reviews.Author: MetGR
Reviews.Content: We had the best experience with the staff. We had to rebook our flight on a sunday, and after letting us do calls with no charge, they offered us to wait on the line for us while we had coffee. Finally after they waited for us on the line, we were able to reboke our flight! Very nice people, and the rooms are very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Paris!”
Reviews.Author: ALZLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Bassano just over New Year and for my first time in Paris! The location was perfect - just off the Champs Elysees - yet set back on a quiet street away from the hustle and bustle but close to all the major attractions and metro stations nearby for those that don't want to walk the streets of Paris! The hotel was clean, contemporary and staff friendly and very helpful! We really couldn't fault it - from the perfect position, to the cool, contemporary design (yes helps if you like turquoise!) with some nice touches like L'occtaine bathroom goodies, robes and slippers. Our room was spacious (esp for Paris) and we had all that we needed in our room. If you are looking for a cool, small boutique hotel i recommend Hotel Bassano - perfect for a Paris trip!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, central and rather lovely”
Reviews.Author: MrsMEG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Bassano for just one night in early December. It is welcoming, the staff helpful and very nicely decorated. Just this thing for a break mini break. Very close the Champs Elysees and metro, but far enough away from the general hubbub.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, extremely clean”
Reviews.Author: lenaman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the beginning of December, for 3 nights. We had a superior room, which was quite large, with a big bathroom and a separate toliet. It was extremely clean and the decoration was rather nice. Small public areas, but who wants to spend time in a hotel when in Paris? I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The ugly duckling - stick to its sister”
Reviews.Author: Gastronauta
Reviews.Content: After many (happy) stays at the Elysee Regencia, I thought I would give this one (same owners) another go. Big mistake. Essentially, the ER is a good 4* boutique - the Bassano is a good 3* boutique...but they cost the same! Rooms are at least 20% smaller at the Bassano on a like-for-like basis The breakfast is rather poor at the Bassano and poor value for money (take only if included in rate otherwise the Brasserie next door is a better option) The lift at the Bassano is the slowest in the western world - I was on the 5th floor and it always took at least 5 minutes to get to reception Staff at the Bassano is surly...not rude just unfriendly...not so at the ER Play the find-the-hairdryer game at the Bassano. Look for the farthest possible location from any mirror and you should win No change of toiletries after first night (so had to ask for shower gel...in a 4* ?) I asked if there was any A/C at reception as room was hot (there is no A/C)...they said sure...I get back from dinner and find all windows open with a subzero temperature. At midnight, I did not see the funny side. I was moved after 2 nights because the Bassano shut for a week (no mention of that when I booked of course) - back to the Elysee...where the room was much nicer and 10% cheaper ! Will return to the ER...never to its ugly little brother. I paid EUR265 for the Bassano room...not worth more than 3 dots...actually 2 but free wi-fi gives it a bonus.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel on a quite street near the Hustle-Bustle”
Reviews.Author: Rashmi E
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel for 4 nights. Its a really stylish small, boutique-y hotel. The location is quite nice as it is close enough to Eiffel Tower and Champs Elysees but on a nice quiet street. The room is on the smaller side, but nicely appointed. I loved the window/balcony concept in the rooms. It was really nice to be able to peep out and take in what was happening on the street. The toilet was separate from the bathroom. The bathroom was ok, good shower pressure and L'Occitane products... I <3 L'Occitane so this made me very happy. On the first day, I blew out the fuse while trying to use one of my American hair styling products. I let the receptionist know and went out to explore the city. Everything was nicely fixed by the time I was back from my walk. They have a small but delicious breakfast buffet each morning. There are many options to eat in the neighborhood. There's a Chinese/Thai place right next door as well. For a quick business trip, this was a nice and comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent third stay at Bassano”
Reviews.Author: janor
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 spent a week at Hotel de Bassano in September 2011. As this was our third time at this hotel we knew what to exoect and indeed we were no disappointed. This hotel is in a perfect location, close to many of the touristy things in Paris and the rooms are among the best and most modern in this city. Their breakfast is excellent and the staff is extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experience Overall”
Reviews.Author: Commat
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night with my wife and we both agreed we made a good choice. We did selected it based on its reputation and after reading reviews on TripAdvisor. We booked online through Prestigia easily and the hotel gave us the room we expected. The Pros: Location, the Staff, Room Service, Big bathroom (for Parisian standard) with bath tub and separate shower, comfortable and clean bed, the decor. The Cons: the toilet room was separate from the bathroom and facing the bed (no much privacy if you have company), no real closet, pricey room, tiny elevator (but it's normal in Paris). The hotel is quiet overall, although like in most hotels you may hear your neighbors in the hall way when they come back to their room late at night. Although we stayed only for one night, I can say that you cannot go wrong with this hotel. It's also a short walk to Champs Elyssees and the Arc du Triomphe (for the rest of the attractions you will take the subway at George V station). It's pricey, yes... but all hotels in Paris are. This one is no different although it's priced more competitively than others we researched before made our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Superbe hôtel”
Reviews.Author: emeryclaire
Reviews.Content: This is very comfortable, stylish and accommodating hotel. Immediately after booking online, I was contacted by Hotel Bassano via email (in English) to review my stay, requests, etc. This was my first international trip with my two-year old daughter. My family travels the world and this hotel ranks as one of the best we have stayed. Clean rooms, large bathrooms, large sleeping chambers (for Paris). They provided a cot with duvet for my daughter. Room service was timely and offered a variety of food styles. We utilized both laundry and airport shuttle services - both being prompt and efficient. We requested a possible early check-in via email ahead of time and they accommodated our request!!! It made the start of the trip even better as we landed early in the day. The elevator is small (2 person max) but that is the charm of Paris!! Great, sophisticated location close to Metro and very quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JenanJamal
Reviews.Content: Modern and Excellent Location for a Hotel in Paris near Champs de Elyssee.In fact, it was very Quite. We booked Suite it was very big a nice but the worst thing that there was no Elevator for the 6th Floor!

Reviews.Title: “charming boutique-like hotel: an oasis away from it, but close to all”
Reviews.Author: Maryandfamily
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Bassano for 8 nights. This charming hotel is small enough to offer a quiet refuge with a personal touch and yet sits just a short walk/blocks away from the Champs Elysees, the Eiffel Tower and both Pont D'Alma and George V Metro lines to afford quick, affordable access to all of Paris's landmarks. Our room offered two twin beds, a safe, a lovely view from the ceiling to floor double doors that opened onto the street which afforded us fresh air and city sounds, a room with sink, shower and bath as well as a separate toilet room. The room was spacious and clean. Housekeeping does an exceptional job. We loved the decor and color palette of this hotel. Hotel Bassano uses swipe card (as opposed to keys) to access rooms and the front door to the hotel is locked with access quickly gained from 24 hour staff at the main desk. From the moment we walked into Hotel Bassano, we felt at home and welcome, due largely to 'Ali' the very kind and knowledgeable man who is one of the hotel's staff attending to the front desk. There is a small business center with computer and printer, a bar, lounge and an overall willingness among staff to make your staff pleasant and to address any needs you may encounter. Hotel Bassano is just a few blocks from the Arch de Triomphe, the Eiffel Tower and several wonderful restaurants, boulangeries, shops, fresh produce/fruit markets. A half block away is a 'grocer' offering a modified selection of 7-11 type products including bottled water, juices, cereal, yogurt, toiletries, snacks, etc. Without fail, every staff member we encounted at Hotel Bassano offered a smile and a willing readiness to make our Paris vacation enjoyable. We wanted for nothing and would definitely make Hotel Bassano our first choice when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant location and accomodating staff”
Reviews.Author: Zan81
Reviews.Content: The biggest draw of this hotel is its brilliant location just off the Champs Elysees, while at the same time, far enough to be away from the hustle and bustle. The Metro is also conveniently located about 5-6 mins away. I do take exception on reviews complaining about the price, as the location on the rather expensive Champs Elysees does justify the price. We had no issues at all checking in, and the Vietnamese lady (I'm so sorry I forgot your name!) was very friendly and efficient. We booked our family of five (ages ranged 18-50) into the suite, and while it is not exactly the biggest suite we have seen, it was comfortable and had enough room for all of us. We in fact decided to save money on the rollaway bed, as the bed provided in the master room was big enough to fit three. Finally, I'd like to pay tribute to the receptionist, Ali, who was very accomodating towards us. After we have checked out by noon and spent the day out, we were tired by evening and had no place else to go, seeing that our train back to London was at night. Ali was kind enough to let us rest in the lounge area, where my mother-in-law could also catch the semi-finals of the French Open 'live' on the TV. Kudos to you Ali, and to Hotel Bassano for making our stay in Paris a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Quite and comfortable Parisian style hotel”
Reviews.Author: cyprianc
Reviews.Content: It's a perfect hotel for those who like to spend the entire day out in the city. The hotel is very small and by that I mean petite. Rooms are also very small but very comfortable, grate shower :-) With the small size came the TV (my laptop screen is bigger :-] ) and a separate WC that if you are taller then 1.8 m you might have a problem with your knees when doing your business. The location is almost perfect, about 5 min walking distance from Metro station and of course Champs-Élysées. Food. We eat on the go always in the city, plenty of small restaurants. No need to eat in the hotel, unless you are on a business trip and don't have the time to go out. Over all, grate little place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Well located boutique hotel with excellent standards and service ideal for couples”
Reviews.Author: trevorandsue
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and checking into our room was no problem. Room was spacious, well appointed and spotlessly clean. Staff were very helpful, courteous and recommended two excellent restaurants close by - Oscars and L'Ecluse. We would go back again tomorrow because we are sure it would be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: devilprincess
Reviews.Content: The hotel is truly one of the best I have stayed in. We had a triple room which I expected to be crowded, as triple rooms usually are. It was not crowded at all. There was plenty of room for all of the luggage and the three beds. The staff were very friendly and courteous and the location was amazing. I believe it was only about 5 blocks to the Champs-Elysees. The hotel was very clean and the street it is located on did not have a lot of traffic on it during the night. It was also only a few minute walk to the nearest metro station. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, clean hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: Sparrett1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Bassano in a superioir double room for a long weekend to celebrate my birthday. The hotel was good value for money as we got an early booking rate that was cheaper than the advertised rate and included breakfast. It is in a great location just off the Champs Elysee and close to a metro station. The hotel was trendy, spotless and clean (and I am very fussy!) and the staff were attentive and helpful without being in your face! I would have no hesitation recommending Hotel Bassano.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: nikaPoa
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel due to it´s charming atmosphere and nice locations. Although the room is very tiny, the decoration is lovely, the beds are confortable and there are some perks like L´Occitane products in the bathroom. What wasn´t nice is that the air conditioner broke and they took 4 days for maintainance, in the summertime.

Reviews.Title: “Very Picky Person- Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LaShondraJ
Reviews.Content: To start off, I am a very picky person when it comes to hotels especially their cleanliness, service, and location. When I enter a Hotel, I am inspecting everything with my eyes. My husband and I searched and searched for hotels for our Christmas/New Years stay in Paris and saw how this hotel kept coming up for high ratings for a decent price. I was concerned though that the reviews about small rooms would affect things but was pleasantly suprised at the space. So, after all of this we booked the Superior Double (room) for a week. Our flight arrived early (10am) and was still pleasantly greeted by Ali for an early check-in eventhough check-in is not usually until 2pm. The room very clean, neat, more than spacious (for a typical Pais hotel). The location was excellent- about 2 blocks from-- Champs Elysees in which on the Rue de Bassano corner had the George V Metro station stop and the Ultimate Plus- the 2 story LOUIS VUITTON! :) I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again if I ever return to Paris. During our stay, Ali helped recommend places to eat for dinner and gave us copies of Menus with prices for our New Years Dinner from several restaurants. Another front desk lady (I forget her name) she actually called the restaurant and made the New Years reservations for us (my french was poor lol!) Also, when we left for the airport to return back to the U.S. we forgot out Macaroons from Laduree in the room and Antoine (not sure about the spelling?) arranged for a Taxi to come pick-up the Macaroons from the hotel and delivered them to the airport. He even called me to make sure that they arrived at the airport to see if I received them. The downfall is that the taxi charged us a ridiculous price though. Also, you could tell the Hotel was renovated somewhat recently because the fresh bold color coat of paint and fresh even lines brought a refreshing NEW smell to the building. THIS IS A FANTASTIC PLACE!

Reviews.Title: “Little great hotel in central location with clean modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: vra303
Reviews.Content: The title pretty much sums up my impression of the hotel. This was the first time I stayed with Bassano - I used to stay with its sister hotel, Hotel Elysee Regencia located just around 1 minute away - and like Elysee Regencia, Hotel Bassano meets my expectation in every way. Modern and tasteful decor, clean and relatively spacious room, good reliable free wifi (most important for business traveller), helpful staff, central location (10 minutes walk from Champs Elysee)... I was satisfied on all counts. One thing this hotel is even better than Elysee Regencia is that the walls are less thin (or at least the walls of my room) so I had better quality sleep here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dtb55
Reviews.Content: I loved this little hotel. The staff couldn't have been friendlier and the hotel was very clean and comfortable. The free high-speed internet and breakfast were major plusses. The rooms are typical in size for Europe, small, but cozy, and the location was great. A little noisy with the windows open, but I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Still our very favourite address to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: RomeoRochesterNY
Reviews.Content: Never been disappointed so far by this gem compared to the mega-places. Quiet location, wonderfully appointed, most gracious personnel. Fabulous beds. Close to the heart of Paris and its attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: niknak1234
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here on a number of occasions both with only my partner (both for business and pleasure) and on another occasion with extended family. This hotel is in a fantastic location and provides a comfortable room with good service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: jjohnson0511
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the Bassano. Rooms were great and spacious for Paris. Front desk was amazing and had great insight into where to go when we had questions. Very close to great shopping, good restaurants. Great hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very pleasant hotel.”
Reviews.Author: wakega11
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location, just a short walk from Champs Elysees. The rooms are comfortable and roomy with a trendy decor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: JeanAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 2 nights at this hotel. Upon check-in we were told that the suite we had booked was not available as a guest had overstayed, so we were offered 2 connecting rooms. I was looking forward to staying in the suite but in fact think this was better as it gave us more space with the children. We were also told that the AC was not working but we were thankfull that it wasnt really that hot and opened the windows for fresh air. The hotel is in easy walking distance of the shops and about 20-25min walk from the Eiffel Tower. The restuarants were lacking though in the general area, apart from some coffee shops where the food was dissapointing, ok if you like omlettes, omlettes and more omlettes! The hotel was of a good standard and the staff were friendly and helpful. Just to add the lift is tiny and a real squeeze with the pushchair. We enjoyed the Occitaine bath products very much. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good, worked with kids”
Reviews.Author: IK-OZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the Bastille Day period for 5 nights. Wife and 2 x children 9 and 13. Position was great - it always helps to be forced to see an icon as part of daily movements and this has the Arc de Triomphe and Champs-Élysées as you walk 5 mins to George V metro. Yellow metro line 1 is very convenient for other main sites - Louvre, Tulleries and direct access to the super station of Chatelet. Also easy downhill walk to Place d'Alma on the Seine for Eiffel Tower viewing, Bateaux-Mouche, Diana homage .... if thats your thing. There is a supermarket 50 metres down the street and a boulangerie literally next door for breakfast. We stayed in the level 6 suite. Hotel Pros: large rooms for Paris - 2 x areas seperated by short passage/bathroom. They made separate beds for the kids which was better than them fighting in a double sofa. Clean modern bathroom. Turn down service. The bedroom actually looked just like the hotel photo when made-up. Little touches - great toiletries, petals in bathroom etc Minor Hotel Cons: flight of steps from level 5 to 6, slowish lift, the beginning signs of wear since the renovation (chipped paint on door etc), a double powerpoint which only allowed one plug to be used at a time. At night you may feel a bit out of it, we pretty much travelled to the Latin Quarter to eat - but Rue Bassano is quiet and after a full day this may be a pro .. More serious hotel cons: The fridge was maybe one degree cooler inside than out which spoilt my initial grocery run (cheese, ham, milk etc) and stopped access to cool drinks. The lack of windows at eye level and below may make some people slightly claustrophobic - though we were fine. I'm sure this is not typical but the aircon was broken for 3 nights and in July on top floor this is serious! After one night we arrived back to find a portable unit (promptly nicknamed the darlek) in the lounge - this was noisy, only sort of did one room and required an open window for the exhaust which was a bit counter productive - but was better than nothing and showed initiative on the part of the hotel. All in all though Paris was probably our favourite city in our London/Rome/Paris trip. The hotel wasn't the best of our trip but it contributed positively to the experience, worked with kids and was definitely was not the downer so easily encountered in London/Paris. Next time I may hunt down an apartment in the Latin area. If not I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JabaGee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, prior to moving into an apartment for a longer stay in Paris. We originally booked a room at their sister hotel, the Elysees Regencia, and were disappointed to learn they were closed for the week - we were offered a room here instead. In the end, we were very happy with the Hotel Bassano. The rooms were cool and really nicely designed - the turquoise theme was actually nice - not as overpowering as it looked on the website. The room was spacious, which was a pleasant surprise given everything we heard about tiny rooms in Paris. The beds and linens were very comfortable. Everything was clean. The room was quiet - good glazing on the windows. Nice bathroom - sleek, nice shower, soaps, robes. We also loved the little touches - a greeting of 3 yummy macarons over rose petals. We thought the location was great - easy walking to everything, but away from big crowds & noise. Overall, a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Noahcpa
Reviews.Content: If you plan to do all the touristy stuff, this hotel is in a great location between the Arc and Eiffel near the Champs and the George V metro. Great breakfast, too.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: LoveB
Reviews.Content: I stayed the Hotel Bassano for 2 night and had a wonderful experience. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are good sized and have everything that you need (well, no hair conditioner but all the other stuff are from Loccitane). The high bed is extremely comfortable and the shower is well cleaned. The only bad thing is that there's no taxi stand nearby so you have to walk to the main road to get one. Overall, it was a perfect stay and we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel if you like turquoise”
Reviews.Author: tripzzzz
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is excellent and staff wonderful. I only rated it four stars because of the color decor and the fact that the hair dryer is hardwired into the desk drawer making it very difficult to use. I really don't think anyone paying over 200 Euros for a standard room is going to steal a hair dryer. Other than these small issues, the hotel is very nice. Breakfast is quite expensive and many excellent options are located within a short walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay, enough room gor 2 adults and 1 child aged 12.”
Reviews.Author: RachelIsrael
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at room 11 on the first floor. The room was spacious enough to accomodate us- 2 adults and our 12 year-old daughter, and the bathroom with L'occitane toiletries was superb! The room was also very clean. The area just beside the hotel is not interesting, which was a little disappointing. Still it is situated just a few blocks from Champs-Elysee and Etoile. So, the location of the hotel is convenient for almost all tourist attractions. We even had a direct train to Euro-Disney from CDG Metro station. To sum-up this is a good hotel but a bit pricey for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “central and pleasant, nice decor, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ai1sa
Reviews.Content: Three of us in a small room, but nicely appointed space, plus size double bed and daughter on the trundler. We were all comfortable. Gorgeous deep bath and beautiful toiletries. Breakfasts were a mild let down.

Reviews.Title: “an excellent non brand name hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: meikant
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel some 29 years past and found the service as helpful and as courteous again this time. With the many cafe / bistro nearby, the absence of a restaurant was no issue.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: gife
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay. Extremely care for the details and very kind staff that is always ready to help. The breakfast is excellent. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Always looking forward to returning to Hotel Bassano”
Reviews.Author: RomeoRochesterNY
Reviews.Content: We just spent four nights again at Hotel Bassano. Same wonderful staff, always helpful and charming, same wonderful welcome, the beds are fantastic. Location is the best. You will not regret your decision to stay there on your next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The location was perfect, the room super and it accommodated three of us”
Reviews.Author: BettyandVeronica
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with my two sisters and had struggled to find a hotel that would accommodate the three of us - Hotel Bassano was perfect. It was situated a short stroll from the Champs Elysees, the hotel was groovy and the room large enough to accommodate the three of us (although not expansive, the room fit three single beds - the third bed was helpfully made up while we went out for supper each evening). Other plus points: the room was clean, the service was friendly and helpful, and staff really responsive if we asked for anything. It's not the cheapest hotel, but it's Paris after all - and certainly one of the best hotels in Paris in which I've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “great location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: travelbug3371
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights. My first time in Paris and my fiance's second. The location was in an upscale part of the city and we felt very safe. The hotel was in a quiet area. I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the room as I expected it to be small like London's hotels. It not overly spacious but we were not crowded. It reminded my of one of my favourite boutique hotels in Vancouver BC (the Opus in Yaletown). The rooms were very clean and my fiance loved the fresh towels later in the day in case he wished to shower before dinner. I loved the towel heater. The bed was great. It was a 3-4 block (5 minute) walk to the metro station. It is very easy to walk to the Eiffle tower and Arc D' Triumph. We had breakfast once (19 euro) and enjoyed it. The staff were very accomodating and helped my print things out and helped with any inquiries. We were very pleased with our choice and I loved Paris. We would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome gem!”
Reviews.Author: DiniToronto
Reviews.Content: My mom, sister and I travelled to Paris along with my 10 month old son for a week of sight seeing and shopping. Upon arrival we were upgraded to the top floor suite which was a fantastic surprise after a long overnight voyage. Can't say enough about this hotel. Upgrade aside, this hotel really gets it. It was clean, well kept, service was phenomenal, location was great...just a few steps away from the George V subway. Seriously, this was a huge find and I'd recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: Bath_UKSarah
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located in Paris, fairly central but not on a busy street and it's close to a fast AirFrance bus link to the airports. Decor and room size were both good, though we had two connected rooms and one had a lot more storage space than the other. Staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. There is a computer and printer in the reception area for guests to use. The breakfast was 19 Euros but was really nice and they had a huge range of foods, and was available from 6.30am till 11 or 11.30am. Chambermaid service varied a bit from day to day but was good overall. TV reception a bit ropey on one of the two English-speaking news channels (the other was showing a BBC documentary about CIA torture techniques - on Boxing Day morning....). The only thing that spoiled our stay there was noise insulation between rooms wasn't good - heavy doors that slam and part wooden floors meant that we could hear the people above us stomping around sometimes, though it wasn't a huge problem. Recommend the wine bar at the back of LaDuree nearby on the Champs Elysee for a drink, and Grand Corona Brasserie at the bottom of Rue Marceau for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Britsdownunder
Reviews.Content: Good friendly service in a hotel that is well located for the champs elysee etc. and, although the rooms were not large (which is the case for most hotels in the center of the city), the layout of two rooms off a common entrance / hallway was perfect for our family.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel,centrally located”
Reviews.Author: engskyri
Reviews.Content: i have spent 6 days at hotel bassano last year with my fiancee.the hotel is ideally located at a avery quiet road in the centre of paris.champs elysee and triumph of arc are at walking distance and iwe enjoyed a lot the facet that we could go shopping get the stuff back at the hotel and then get out again after an hour of rest for more shopping or a coffee. rooms are well decorated although the grey tones are a bit depressing when travelling on winter time at paris(it was freezing and kept on raining during our stay) the breakfast is basic but of a good standard and the hotel stuff are more than helpfull.this is a very small hotel and you get to know the stuff after a couple of days.during my stay i was sick one day and everybody tried to do its best to assist me. all in all my experience with hotel bassano was perfect.i think that it is the best value for money in paris.if you can splash some cash then go for a high end paris hotel but if you want a good stay on a centrally located hotel then hotel bassano is the one for you!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: BetitaMarimba
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to the champs elysees (just a block behind LV headquarter). Nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: LondonPika
Reviews.Content: The staff really made an effort and obviously happy to help in any way they could. The location was also really convenient, very near the top of the Champs Elysees.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and very well located hotel to spend a romantic weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Matrod
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hidden gem in Paris. It´s very well located, just 4-5 minute walk from the Arc de Triomphe and 10-12 minutes away from the Tour Eiffel and Champ de Mars. The nearest subway station is George V, located in the Champs Elysees Avenue, just in front of many brand stores, like Louis Vuitton, Mercedes Benz and so on. The staff was very helpful and they even spoke spanish! Well done, since my french is getting rusty! The neighborhood is quiet, with some cafés and bakeries nearby, if you want to avoid paying for breakfast at the hotel (a little bit expensive for our taste (19 euros), since you can get very good croissants and café au lait for 2-3 euros walking a little from the hotel. The room was big by Paris standards, the bed nice and soft, no noise aside of some happy and tipsy people shouting in the street for a little while, and the bathroom was spectacular. The only "weird" thing was that the toilet was located outside the main bathroom space... In general, a very good spot for a romantic getaway. Don´t miss the Kambogdia restaurant just walking a few steps from the hotel entrance. Food and service are simply marvelous! Only downside? A bit expensive (245 euros for a Double Superior Room), but it was worth it!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem with excellent rooms and good location”
Reviews.Author: shinyligustrum
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a week-long stay at Hotel Bassano. The front desk person who greeted us (Ali?) was absolutely wonderful for the entire visit. Our room was ready well before their normal check-in time, and everyone was able to speak English (though I wish we spoke better French). The hotel interior design was contemporary and clean, which suited our tastes perfectly. We had a queen bed with a view that overlooked the quiet Rue Bassano...and the windows actually opened, which was so nice! There were 3 French macarons waiting for us -- which were amazing. The bathroom was always clean and equipped with an amazing shower head (rain fixture with lots of water pressure), and it was supplied with L'Occitane products, slippers, and bath robes. The housekeeping staff was amazing - the room was always "put back together" with fresh towels, etc. It's true that the hairdryer was in an odd location, but the cord was long enough to use the full-length mirror attached to the inside of the bathroom door. It's also true that there was no "closet" but there was really plenty of space to hang clothes, as well as shelves and drawers to store clothes. Location was great. Quiet street, except for some construction on a building nearby. Easy walk to George V metro, which got you basically anywhere. Quick, easy walk to Pont de l'Alma (with view of Eiffel Tower), which had a metro stop with RER access for a day trip into Versailles. They also had a computer, in case you didn't want to take advantage of the in-room wifi. Also, upon checking out, Ali at the front desk looked up our flight info and told the taxi driver which gate we were flying out of -- in French -- which was just so nice of him. The only negative was this - we were never given a message left for us at the front desk by some friends of ours in town. We only learned that they had stopped by the hotel, inviting us to breakfast, when we returned to the US. I'm sure it was an honest oversight. Overall, we would definitely return to Hotel Bassano and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: JMSamuel
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful 5 days in this hotel in Mid-October, my partner actually stayed on for an additional 5 days for business. The room was spacious compared to most Paris hotel rooms and had a beautiful contemporary design. The location, 4 blocks from the Champs and the Metro, could not be beat yet it was not on a crowded or noisy street. The staff was great, finding the exact restaurants requested that were not frequented by tourists and did not have outrageous prices, but had stupendous food. The one and only issue is that in the renovation a year ago they did not have closets in the rooms. Rather, they have contemporary attached hangers but not enough. We ended up putting our hangers on their hangers. We will definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: SandyWang
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay in this hotel. Prior to Hotel Bassano, we stayed a few days in London. Comparing with the two, I love the personal touch of the Bassano. They gave you a pocket map of Paris, and an English visitor guide to Paris. The room was not spacious, but had everything you need. Rooms are sportless. Clean towels are provided more than once a day. Many times, we came to hotelafter some sightseeing, showered and rest, before heading out again. When we came back, new towels have been provided and shower/bath tub were scrubed clean. I really had no complaints and very satisfied we choose it.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a gem”
Reviews.Author: gsuther
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on line not knowing what to expect and the moment I arrived I was impressed. The service from empoyees exceeded my expectations and the room was bright and clean and just large eneough for us. You cannot beat the location, close to transportation and all the sights we wanted to see.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, great service, minor annoyances only”
Reviews.Author: tp_melb
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a superior room (king bed, bathroom with separate shower & bath, separate toilet, bar fridge & clothes / storage space) for 5 nights. We paid a reduced, albeit still high price via the hotel website - beyond the upper end of our hopes for a stay in Paris, but it seems about par for the standard of room / hotel we were wanting. Complimentary wifi access was useful, and an in-house computer/printer was great for printing boarding passes prior to our departure. The location is great - a full view of the Eiffel Tower (5 mins walk) greeted my wife's & my bleary eyes at the beginning of our run along the Seine each morning. It's a similar distance from the Champs Elysees and many of the typical tourist monuments that make you feel like you're in Paris. The main downside on location was that we drove to Paris, and the rented GPS unit - bless her robotic heart - kindly directed me to the hotel via the chaotic Arc de Triomphe. As roundabouts go, it makes a good theme park ride - the aftermath is more fun than the experience! (PS street parking was free on Saturdays & Sundays, but in-house parking was expensive at EUR29 - we'd recommend returning the car and using the metro / tour buses). The hotel staff - one gentleman in particular - were fantastically responsive and courteous. Our attempts at French were met by polite responses in English, and our inquiries were followed up during subsequent discussions (e.g. we complained about noise from the room above - a call was made to the room immediately, and we were asked on the next two days whether the issue had been resolved satisfactorily). The room itself was great, which was expected for the price. The king bed (two king singles combined) was very comfortable, and the double glazed windows were effective in reducing noise to a level we could sleep through (we're light sleepers). The main negative issue was the resounding thud whenever the guests above us were either walking heavily or carting bags around ... but with the exception of one family, this was generally limited to daylight hours. We would have liked access to an iron & ironing board for the duration of our stay, but the one time we had one it was removed the next time the room was serviced. All in all a pleasant stay, and the hotel deserves its rating. The price isn't compelling, but we'd definitely stay here again if we can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem off des Champs Elysees”
Reviews.Author: Soulchyld
Reviews.Content: The photos do not prepare you for how chic and quaint this hotel is. It is approximately three blocks from des Champs Elysees and five from la Rive Seine. The breakfast is outstanding! Though it is 20 euro, it is all you can eat. The free internet service is great! I would stay here again in a heartbeat! Loved the bathroom and the L'Occitane products!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good stay at the Bassano”
Reviews.Author: Galway_Lady
Reviews.Content: The location of the Bassano is very good, about 5 minutes walk from the Champs Elysees. The Air France bus from CDG Airport (exit 34) leaves you at Avenue Carnot directly behind the Arc de Triomphe. You can then use the underground passageway beneath the Arc to get to the Champs Elysees. First impressions were not great, the receptionist was quite abrupt. All other staff I encountered apart from her were very pleasant and helpful. The rooms are nice, a decent size and clean. For the price I paid I felt that breakfast could have been included. There are plenty of places to eat on the Champs Elysees and this is what I did-rather than paying 19 euro for what appeared to be a fairly average breakfast. There is also a little shop just down the street which is very handy for snacks, bottled water etc. Overall a pleasant stay and Paris is an amazing and magical city.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay @ Hotel Bassano”
Reviews.Author: IslandJudy
Reviews.Content: Being a bit of a hotel snob I was a bit leary on booking at the Hotel Bassano for my first trip to Paris. To all my fellow hotel snobs you have nothing to worry about. Everything about this hotel is fantastic. The decor is chic and modern. Rooms and beds were comfy and clean. They even provided robes, slippers and turn down service w/o being asked which is more than I can say for the Marriott we stayed at later in our trip. The free wi-fi and L'Occitane products were other perks that we enjoyed. Be sure to ask for a wi-fi code that will last your entire stay b/c otherwise they expire after 24 hrs. The location was a short walk to Champs-Élysées and convenient to the metro as well. Upon our arrival the front desk provided us with maps which were helpful navigating the city. We had a fantastic time and plan to return to the Hotel Bassano on own next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Restful stay after flight... quiet and peaceful location, especially at night”
Reviews.Author: 2011Bruins
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the suite for 2 nights… decent-sized room overall with a separate sitting/TV viewing room that has a chair/couch. The bed was large enough (I’m 6’5) if not a little firm… but we seemed to sleep fine. The bathroom is nice enough with a combined shower/tub… and roomy enough to allow for getting ready, etc. This room is located in the top floor as described on the website… but the elevator only reaches the floor just below, so there will be a couple stairs you’ll need to walk to reach this level. The front desk is overall very helpful… but do your restaurant research before going to Paris… the recommendations of the hotel(s) can be spotty and most times they seem almost too touristy. There was one gentleman, working at night, that didn’t seem to be interested in assisting us with directions to our restaurant. By the way, the hotel recommended Café de L’Homme for dinner… unless you want to pay a lot for a view of the Eiffel Tower at night, do yourself a favor and skip it… service and food were not close to being worth the $. The location was fine, especially at night as it seemed to become very quiet… you’re very close to the George V Hotel… highly recommended for great service, a high-priced cocktail, and some celebrity spotting too (Lebron James one of the nights we stopped in).

Reviews.Title: “good place to be”
Reviews.Author: gastjunior
Reviews.Content: excellent location in center of Paris. Near from the Champs Elysées but "quiet". Staff is very profesional. Ratio: quality/price is very good. I will be happy to come back asap.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: canuck64
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris. Nice hotel in a great location. Walking distance to Arc de Triomphe, and Champs des Elysees. Very clean and quiet. Staff was very helpful. Breakfast is too expensive, many options close by.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Dee28
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Bassano for 4 nights in July for a conference at Palais du Congres (and some shopping and sight-seeing on the side). I paid 195 Euros per night including breakfast for a standard room. I caught a taxi to the hotel from Gare St Lazare which cost 7 Euros (on a Sunday with little traffic). The hotel is about a 1km walk from George V metro stop which is on the yellow line (line 1). As you exit the train station take the Rue Georges V exit not the Champs Elysees one and it will bring you out on the rue Bassano side of Champs Elysees. There is an escalator for the last section up to street level. Rue Bassano is right on your left and if you walk about 4 blocks down you'll come to it on the right (it's on a corner). The hotel is modern and rooms really comfortable and large. My room had a king bed (it was 2 twins joined together), a bathroom with a large modern bath and shower over bath and a separate toilet. The bed was very comfortable. The TV had English channels (BBC) as well as French. Breakfast was pretty standard although I did think it was a bit overpriced for 19 Euros. There were limited cereals, bacon, eggs, pastries, cheese, cold meats and fruit. There is a separate bar area which looked quite funky but on the one night I decided to have a drink it was closed and I sat in the breakfast area instead. There is a little computer nook with a brand new MAC computer for free internet use and printing. There is also free wifi in the rooms which worked really well. The hotel is ideally based for those who don't mind walking. It is about a 20 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, a 5 minute walk to Champs Elysees, 30 minute walk to the Louvre, 45 minute walk to Notre Dame and Latin Quarter. I wouldn't say that the area it is in is particularly vibrant ie. there are not a lot of cafes etc etc but it is a nice quiet area that appears safe. There is a bakery next door, a little bar/cafe opposite and a tapas restaurant a couple of metres down on rue Bassano. I caught a taxi from the hotel to the CDG airport at 8.15am on a Thursday morning and it took about 40 minutes and cost 50 Euros. If you're looking for a great way to see a less touristy side of Paris I'd highly recommend the Bike About Tour (it's number 2 on the Things To Do list for Paris http://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g187147-d652724-Reviews-Bike_About_Tours-Paris_Ile_de_France.html and gives you a great orientation to the city).

Reviews.Title: “It does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: PaulandKim
Reviews.Content: I booked a two night stay for my partners 50th birthday, this also coincided with Bastille Day. The experience that I had with this hotel from the time of booking until the moment that we left was one of excellence. I had some special requests and the e-mails were always answered promptly, usually within thirty minutes. We arrived much earlier than the official check in time but were greeted warmly and accomodated immediately. The superior room was located on the 4th floor with a corner aspect. This meant that we had three fully opening windows (if you count the bathroom). The room was airy and finished to a high standard, everything worked and it was spotless. All the staff went about their business with a "can do" attitude which made us feel welcome rather than a burden on their working day. The special suprises that I had arranged were all provided as planned, even to discreetly asking if my partner was aware of them and did I want them kept secret. A nice touch I thought. The location is ideal for the immediate must see sights and with the George V metro station only a short stroll away the more distant attractions can be reached easily and with little fuss. Would i stay here again? You bet I would.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, comfortable, good location”
Reviews.Author: fouroffive
Reviews.Content: We love to walk and did from here to Arc de Triomphe, Eifel Tower, Louvre, and many other places. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Bed very comfortable and yes, real king, not 2 pushed together doubles. A/C was very strong so we kept cool when needed. Thai place next door was delicious. Free wireless. Other nearby quick, inexpensive eateries were closed on weekends, so keep this in mind when you plan your trip. Would definitely go here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Kurraj0ng
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Bassano for 3 nights and had a wonderful time. Our room was clean and comfortable, as well as elegant. The rose petals on a dish in the bathroom was a lovely touch. We appreciated being so close to the Arc De Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower. To top it off, the customer service was fabulous. Definitely a place to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel !”
Reviews.Author: 47Paris
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a romantic, special hotel to book in Paris for my Fiance's 40th Birthday and wasn't disappointed with Hotel Bassano. We booked the hotel shuttle bus for collection too and from the airport. Very good service and would recommend booking, cheaper than taxi and more civilised than the metro. Our room was modern, clean, great toiletries, bathrobes, slippers, mini bar, safe, coffee making etc. Hairdryer was a little tricky, as this is fixed into a draw and doesn't allow for much flex.....so take your own ladies (and gentlemen)! Spoil the person you love with a romantic package......this includes on arrival.....music, half bottle of champagne, rose petals on the bed in the shape of a heart, candles.......well worth it ...and you won't be disappointed ! Hotel is in a great location, about a 10 minute walk to the Arc de triomphe and Champs-Elysees and approx. 20 min walk to the Eiffel Tower. Should we be so lucky to visit Paris again....I would choose Hotel Bassano to stay. Good luck with your booking...hope this helps !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location - Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: papitoquerido
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bassano is a great little hotel in Paris. It is very well situated on rue Bassano; very near to Avenue des Champs-Elysées (about four blocks). Accessible by metro (George V station). The area where the hotel is located is truly privileged. Just three blocks from the famous Four Seasons Hotel (George V) and prime shopping along Avenue Georges V. The staff was great! Ali, Anthoine, Pierre (who’s Spanish is perfect) and the two young concierge ladies at the front desk. We planned our visits with them in the morning and asked them to make restaurant and show reservations for each evening. All the staff was very courteous and professional. The hotel is exactly as advertised on the Internet site. We had a superior room with two showers, desk, a small LCD TV, mini-bar, safe, hair dryer, bath robes, slippers, coffee maker, etc.) with a nice view to rue Bassano on the 5th floor (yes, there is an elevator…). There are older pictures of the hotel on certain websites before it was renovated. I am enclosing some pictures of the hotel I took during our recent trip. You will enjoy staying at Hotel-Bassano!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Gateway, Perfect Location, Best City Hotel in Europe”
Reviews.Author: MUNYEKA
Reviews.Content: I would like to thanks Hotel Bassano and front desk, especially Olympe. This is one of the most friendly city hotels in Europe. I travel all around Europe for many years and I loved hotel Bassano. Location is perfect; you can walk to several different Metro stations. You can also walk to several small local cafes. We arrived very early to hotel and usually you do not get your room right away. However, we got our room right away and people are extremely friendly during our entire stay. Every single recommendation from hotel whether for breakfast, lunch or dinner was great. I will for sure come back and stay with them and I really recommend this hotel. As a family, we are very difficult in terms of hotel selections, but this hotel become one of our favorite along with Hillside Club in Fethiye, Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: CFYow
Reviews.Content: During our brief holiday in Paris this week, we stayed at the Bassano. The location of the hotel is perfect - just 5 minutes walk to the Champs D' Elysees and close by to almost everything - the metro, restaurants, shopping etc, The staff is polite and friendly, especially Ali who helped us map out our self-tours. Definitely a great little hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel with clean rooms, helpful staff and a great location.”
Reviews.Author: mandeb60
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while he was on business and we loved it. The superior room was quiet, the bed was large, and the room was cleaned to a high standard. The hotel staff were friendly, helpful and mindful of our privacy and the amenities were plentiful, extending to bath robes, slippers and chocolates with the turn down service. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and look forward to staying here again on future visits to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: Vinifs
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel in this site and trusted on the reviews. And I was right! Everything was 100% good and i recommend for everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: Letsrun26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Bassano for the Paris Marathon, so location was important. We couldn't have asked for a better hotel, and will definitely return. The staff was friendly and accomodating, even letting us check in at 10:30 giving us a chance to nap and freshen up before hitting the Champs. Access to the George V Metro stop gets you just about anywhere (10 tickets for 11.40 euros). The rooms were clean and comfortable, having recently been upgraded. Evening turndown service and little chocolates were a nice touch. Rose petals in the bath, L'Occotane products, robes & slippers, towel warmer, and flat screen TV were standard in our room. Other than having to call the desk for an iron, all of our needs were met. One thing we had to figure out on our own was how to turn the power on to the room. Near the door is a little slot for you to place your room key in. That activates the power to the room. However, you could use the plugs under the nightstands without the key, which was handy to charge phones and camera batteries while we were out. We can't wait to start planning our next trip to Paris...and The Hotel Bassano will certainly be a part of it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Find”
Reviews.Author: suntraveller2006
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night break staying at this super little hotel. From the moment we arrived the staff were friendly and very helpful. The room was very comfortable and the power shower great - everything you want from a city hotel, especially after a busy day pounding the streets of Paris. The location was ideal 5 mins from the Arc de Triomphe and 10 mins to the Eiffel Tower in the other direction. A great find will definately go back to this personal hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Demoknite
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! Reception staff were kind, spoke English and recommended some restaurants for us. There is a turn down service so its nice to have a little chocolate, the sheets turned back and the curtains closed. Had the continental breakfast in bed which you can better value for money outside of the hotel. They also had free internet (quite fast too) which in this age is as important as offering a phone in the room. Not enough hotels are offering this. The location is great as its a five minute walk from George V Métro station right in the middle of the Champs E. The Arc is also a very short walk. Great locale and great staff. Will stay again if visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: KittyCatSingapore
Reviews.Content: I had to go to Paris for a short meeting and didn't want to pay the exhorbitant prices in the city, so I turned to Trip Advisor. This hotel was ranked up there with some of the best. Check in was personalised and since I checked in really early, they offered me a drink in the lobby while they finish cleaning up my room. I only had to wait 5 minutes. Loved the room - spacious, new and clean for a Paris hotel. It's really comfortable. Bath comes with separate and shower stall. Amenities are great with complimentary coffee tea making facilities. The hotel is only 3 mins from Champ Elysee and internet access is free. Just ask front desk for the password. I will definitely come back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: harriet76
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend at Hotel Bassano. It is 5 minutes walk from the Champs Elysee (George V Metro), 10-15 mins to Eiffel Tower. Very comfortable beds, extremely friendly and helpful staff with good restaurant recommendations. Good size room with plenty of space, lovely decor, nice bathroom with L'Occitane products. T&C making facilities which you often don't get in Europe in addition to a mini bar and complimentary macaroons! Very good food Definitely recommended

Reviews.Title: “Excellent find!”
Reviews.Author: Awaywithoutkids
Reviews.Content: Had booked this weekend as a surprise for my husbands 40th, so really wanted to make sure the hotel was right. Spent hours on trip advisor trying to find a boutique hotel in a good location that didn't cost the earth. Well, Hotel Bassano was perfect. Having heard that generally Paris hotel rooms are small, this wasn't the case here. It is very modern, clean and the staff were very helpful. We did manage to get a good deal with the hotel direct, including breakfast so that made staying at a 4* hotel more affordable. Only negative comments would be the lack of a hotel bar and availability of English newspapers. Definitely recommend it though.

Reviews.Title: “Woderful Bassano - great location”
Reviews.Author: oldmanofthesea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bassano from 30th Dec to 2nd Jan 09 and thought it was excellent. We had two standard double rooms on the top floor and found them very comfortable - especially the very comfy kingsized beds! Hanging space was limited but mini bar, tea and coffee, tv, bathroom and separate w.c. were great size and quality fittings. Great friendly service from all the staff. The location is brilliant - 10 mins walk to Champs Elysee and Arc De Triomphe or 15 mins The River Seine and Eiffel Tower in the opposite direction, lots of cafes and restaurants and an easy taxi ride to Moulin Rouge. Going back in the Spring!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Small Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: cambridge02138
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific small hotel with all the amenities (free internet, great included breakfast, comfortable room, modern bathroom) and wonderful staff. It is on a reasonably small side street within easy walking distance of metro and various museums. We have stayed at many small (and some large) Paris hotels and this is by far the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: 00O00
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, modern, nicely decorated, very clean small hotel in a fabulous location off the Champs-Elysees; short walking distances to the Eiffel Tower, the River Seine, L'Arc de Triomphe, shopping, and restaurants. Excellent access to George V station for the metro system, or easy to find a cab, bus, or tour bus within a block or so. We also walked to La Louvre. The bed was comfortable, the linens were crisp and fresh, L'Occitane soaps and products were provided at no charge, as well as other nice touches such as cookies, chocolates at turn-down, and most of all an excellent, friendly, multi-lingual staff who truly cares about the guests and does whatever they can to ensure that your visit to Hotel Bassano and Paris are pleasant and enjoyable. I found this 4-star-rated hotel on a website. The pictures and descriptions are accurate of what is there. The lady who assisted me on the telephone when making our reservation was incredibly helpful, as she provided insight to the hotel's superb location, that it was newly redone, why it was a good location for visiting Paris, and she did a great job of describing the accomodations. She was prompt and efficient, as well as were subsequent e-mail confirmations. We stayed there four days/three nights, thus met several of the staff members; all were wonderful. Clearly, the management is doing a very good job in training all the staff how to properly run a hotel to make the guests want to return, as well as recommend it to others. (We are a married couple, living in London, although from the USA.)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic find in Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Trevorcraig
Reviews.Content: Like others, I went to this hotel with high expectations. I was not let down. Their website is a very good depiction of what to expect. This boutique hotel is modern, tastefully decorated with a great location to get around Paris, and a great breakfast. It is pricey at €19 for continental breakfast but of a very high quality. You really do get what you pay for. Like all hotels in Paris, the rooms are a bit small so do not be expecting American size bedrooms even though the bed was kingsize. What made this hotel for us was the exceptional service of the staff who were very friendly, spoke english, very professional and such a change from the "Gallic charm" you will experience in other hotels in France. I'll be back the next time I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Bassano!”
Reviews.Author: FabSussex
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Bassano with my wife and daughter and can fully recommend it. The Reception Staff were extremely knowledgable and were able to recommend places to eat, and offer lots of other advice. The room was well presented, comfortable and felt spacious because of the separate area for clothes, and large bathroom. My wife loved the 'L'Occitane' toiletries (as did I!). Bed was huge and comfortable, and our window opened onto a quiet street. Location was great, with only a 5 minute walk to the Champs Elysees, Seine and Metro. Also found a great bakery just next to the hotel, perfect for a pain au chocolat and coffee. Also just a few yards from a 'Velib' free bike stand ( a really good way to get around ). Overall, it was an excellent hotel, with excellent staff and an excellent location. Ideal for a few days away .

Reviews.Title: “A Woderful Small Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonewales
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this delightful small hotel on28th & 29th October.The reservation process was easy and convenient and resposes to queries prompt and precise, as we needed a 3 bedded room for my wife & I and our grandson who we were giving a birthday treat. On arrival we were delighted to be upgraded to a suite which peased my granson . The hotel staff could not have been more helpful nothing was too much trouble and the restaurant recommendations were excellent,as was the buffet breakfast. If you want to stay in Paris the location is ideal for sightseeing and I would highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “boutique style hotel near arc de triomphe just off champs elysees”
Reviews.Author: troublenstrife
Reviews.Content: Booked romantic package for 3 nights in superior room costing 975euros Checked in at 11am & left bags behind reception with friendly advice that check in was after 2pm. We returned at 3pm after a stroll around Eiffel Tower which was 15 mins walk away from the hotel & waited 5 minutes to find luggage had been taken up to our room (41 facing north) . Pre ordered music candles & half bottle champagne, small fancy cakes,- rose petals arranged in heart shape on bed was lovely - we were here to mark 20 years of being together. Well decorated clean room with huge bed, seperate bathroom to WC felt like a small apartment with french windows opening inward - we sat in window with champagne & baguettes (bought at nearby convenience shop) looking on to beautiful french townhouse - no city views from hotel. Breakfast in small area close to reception - got busy with smartly dressed French business guests -very good selection - pancakes & syrup, pastries, toast, scambled eggs, fruits yoghurts,juices, cereals (plus more) although milk for cereal not chilled there was a small fridge with cheeses & boiled eggs. Found Paris very expensive due to exchange rate but worth it especially in the lovely sunshine we had. All the tourist sites had large queues but recommend the hour wait for Notre Dame 7.50euro each to go to the top (queue down left side as you look at the cathedral - the queue in the front entrance is for looking inside for free) and dont miss the eiffel tower lit up at night. Metro similar to london underground 5.30 euro each for all day pass. Go to small Orangrie gallery on the place de la concorde for Monets huge water lilie canvases - get there @ 9am & be the only ones there No sight of upgrade or parting gifts as other guests mentioned but good superior room with bathrobe & complimentary slippers Recommend

Reviews.Title: “Oct 2008”
Reviews.Author: HKML
Reviews.Content: -just finished renovation -hotel location is great, close to George V Metro Station -good service -clean room and bathroom -value for money -perfect for young couple -free wifi at request

Reviews.Title: “Truly Awesome Experience.....!!”
Reviews.Author: UMKhan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Bassano for four nights on our trans-european vacation this year....I cant thank my lucky stars enough to have booked Bassano as we were travelling with 2 toddlers and anything other than Bassano would not have sufficed....It has been truly a great experience staying with them...Great and friendly staff (Who all spoke good English by the way!) went much beyond their way to help us out in anyway asked. The location was AWESOME with Champs Elysee, Arc de Triomphe, Eiffel Tower all within walking distance. With two babies, it must have been challenging for the house keeping to keep up with our room, but they did a great job i must say...! On my next trip to Paris, I am definitely coming back here...!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: davsuze
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. It has a great location that is within short walking distance of the Champ Elysees, Arc de Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower. The Louvre was a 45 minute walk but well worth it. The deluxe room was very modern and the bathroom very nice by European standards, it had a great shower and bath tub. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They spoke english which helped greatly and they offered advise on all that we needed including helping us find a room after we checked out due to the chunnel fire. The staff made this a 4 star hotel and the location and the hotel made it a great place to stay. We would stay here again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic weekend away”
Reviews.Author: saz24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Bassano over Bank Holiday weekend and was not dissapointed at all. The hotel is in a great location, very central to many of the sites but down a quite street so not much noise immediatley outside your window. When we checked in we were upgraded and our room was of a good size and immaculate. The room was a little cold so when i phoned reception to ask how to increase the heating they said they had turned it off because of the time of year but within 1/2 hr a small heater was delievered to our room. The reception staff were incredibly helpful and had no problem making restaurant reservations or ordering cabs for us. We chose to have breakfast delivered to the room on both days and although a little expensive it set us up for the day. Overall, we were incredibly impressed with the Hotel Bassano and couldnt fault it one bit. Great for a weekend away when you know that as soon as you get there you are going to feel at home straight away and can get on with seeing the sites and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kcplaza2001
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 8 nights at Hotel Bassano in early June. Having traveled throughout Europe on business, I'm accustomed to small rooms and mediocre service. Hotel Bassano was a wonderful, refreshing change. We were greeted by Ali, the always friendly and helpful front desk attendant who made us feel at home from day one. The rooms were large, clean and well light. The bathroom was so very spacious, modern and clean. The bed was very comfortable, a king size which is not common in Europe. Location might be the best part of the hotel. Your minutes away from the metro, Eiffel Tower and other key tourist attractions. But what I loved about it was it was in a very quiet neighborhood, allowing you to get away from the madness that can be Paris. We'd stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bandalow
Reviews.Content: Paris: The Bassano Hotel Paris. "Fabulous Hotel" June 2008 Reviewer : A Trip Advisor Member Gold Coast Queensland Australia. Arrived at Hotel very early the morning of June 18th and was greeted with a lovely smile from Laetitia. Our room was not quite ready, but was asked to go to the breakfast room for a lovely hot cup of tea while we waited. We had a lovely chat with staff while we waited and was then taken to our room. The room was really bright and airy,so lovely and modern with new paint work, timber floors, comfy large bed and a very modern bathroom. Just loved having a bath with all the beautiful products that were supplied. Breakfast was really nice with hot and cold meals, the staff every morning greeted you with a smile and a good morning. The location of this hotel is just perfect... we have been to Paris many a time before, but our first time at this hotel and we would only ever stay at this hotel again.!!! The morning of our departure I was given a gift and a hand written card in a beautiful box from the staff I couldn't believe it.( It was hand cream) Laetitia at reception is very pregnant and we do wish her well with the new arrival. We will be back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bassano”
Reviews.Author: ChefJacquie
Reviews.Content: Our group just returned from a great vacation in France. Cannot say enough good things about this lovely hotel - we stayed in a 2 bedroom family suite and had ample room. Hotel Bassano staff went above and beyond their call of duty - they helped us plan an itinerary, recommneded eateries for breakfast/lunch/ dinner and made reservations. They knew our names and greeted us everytime we entered or departed the hotel. Our rooms were very clean, loved the heated towel rack, macaroons and chocolates left when at turn down every night!!!! They have a wonderful buffet breakfast - the location of the hotel is fantastic, the exclusive George V - metro stations within walking distance. Our group had quite a few teenagers and they also thought the hotel was chic! Our group agrees, we have found our home away from home, when visiting Paris, it's called Hotel Bassano.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location-Hotel Bassano”
Reviews.Author: Crikey08
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay in Paris and were fortunate to have stayed at the Hotel Bassano. From the moment we walked through the front door, to the time we unfortunately had to leave to return home, the staff at the Bassano couldn't do enough to make sure our stay in Paris was just perfect. The hotel has been recently renovated and everything is provided in the rooms to ensure our stay was enjoyable. The staff were exceptional and nothing was too much trouble. They certainly disproved our belief about expected service standards in Paris. The location of the hotel allows an easy (5 minutes at the most) walk to the Arc de Triumph and Champes Elysee and 10 minutes to Eiffel Tower. I would most definitely recommend the hotel to travellers looking for a place to stay that is central and provides exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and fantastically located”
Reviews.Author: MissMesopotamia
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Residence Bassano. We stayed there for three nights including New Year's Eve and found it perfectly located for Paris sightseeing. The Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees about five minutes' walk away. The hotel was quiet, and our room, though modestly sized was beautifully appointed with chic French provincial furnishings. The bathroom was big and lavish with L'Occitaine toiletries and fluffy towels. There was also a PC behind the lobby with free 9medium speed) internet for guests which was handy for booking onward arrangements. Reception was quiet and unassuming; we had no outrageous requests but they were cordial and helped us book a couple of tours. Breakfast was not included in the price so we only ate in the hotel one morning - it was plentiful and well-prepared, if a little expensive. There were a couple of good restaurants nearby. As swish an area as Bassano is in, (and let's face it, as lovely as Paris is) I do NOT recommend Paris for New Year's Eve. Reception warned us against gathering at the Eiffel Tower at midnight because of crime and 'hooliganism.' Set menu dinners at any of the nearby restaurants was over 200 euros a head. We ended up staying in and toasting 07 with Champagne and ice cream and were awoken after 2am by drunk revellers, and the sound of breaking glass on the streets outside. On New Year's morning, there were broken liquor bottles and more than a few pools of vomit on the footpaths around the hotel, in addition to the requisite piles of dog poo. A real shame, given how beautiful the city is and how important tourism is to the Parisians that they don't make more of an effort to keep it clean. Nonetheless, the hotel was very pleasant and comfortable, and I would recommend it, especially for couples. I do not agree with the assessment that it's good for families with kids - it's pretty elegantly furnished, quiet, lots of light-coloured soft furnishings, and doesn't lend itself very well to a lot of noise and activity.

Reviews.Title: “small and stylish”
Reviews.Author: myjourney
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our short stay. Upon our early arrival, rooms were not ready. The receptionist had us look at 3 choices of superior rooms which was nice. We chose 11, one flight up so we could avoid the elevator and it has good privacy with a short entrance hallway. The lobby and the breakfast area are quite small . For Breakfast there were good fresh croissants and fresh fruit etc. The neighborhood of the 16th arrondissement is wonderful. Lots to see within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “clean boutique hotel with outstanding customer service”
Reviews.Author: skimmy
Reviews.Content: the hotel bassano is located just off the champs-elysee and was within walking distance from the air france bus stop (line 2 - assuming you don't have loads of heavy luggage). while our room was not ready when we checked in (we were really early), they graciously offered us hot tea or coffee when we arrived. the lobby area is a bit small and the price of the morning buffet deterred us from trying it. when we finally checked into the room, it was extremely clean and well kept. i found it a little odd that the toilet was separate from the rest of the bathroom and it was in the tiniest closet! but the front desk was always courteous and extremely helpful. i had purchased a one-hour internet card and found that it didn't work after less than an hour's use. they gave me a new one in exchange. this was a bit of a last minute trip and many of the other hotels we tried were sold out. however for the money and service, i think the hotel bassano clearly stood out in a sea of 3-star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Bassano Definitely Above Average”
Reviews.Author: Canada_One
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Paris for 3 nights as part of a small European tour (London, Paris, Barcelona). I have posted hotel reviews for all these locations. Booked Bassano on strength of Trip posts. We were upgraded to a Superior room, and I am beginning to wonder if they even have an "Standard" rooms, based on other reviews. However the room was quite nice. Only complaint is the seperate WC (as most are in France) was right there as you walked in the door, and the shower was on the other side of the room. Kinda strange configuration. We were able to switch to another room for the remaining two nights of our stay. It has a much better configuration, with a small hallway leading into the room, and the WC next to the shower / washroom. Get one of these rooms if you can. Overall the hotel was clean and quiet, even though windows open to the street. Very soundproof windows. There was a few areas where the hotel is showing its age, a little paint peeling here and there. A staff member indicated the entire hotel will soon be undergoing a significant renovation. However it was not that bad and did not detract from our stay. As with the Chesterfield Hotel in London, staff here were excellent, and most helpful in all respects.
