Location of hotel was one of the features, and we were very happy with being able to walk to le Champs and many major attractions. For breakfast we ate at boulangeries instead of the hotel, and saved about 50% of the cost vs. the hotel. As travellers know, breakfast at any hotel anywhere is usually 2 to 4 times the cost at a "regular" local diner. Last day was a Sunday and there was nothing open, so we ate at hotel and it was very good. Had two dinners in Paris, Laduree on the Champs Eleysee (on the recommendation of Frommers, somewhat disappointing) and at La Fermette Malbouf (on the recommendation of the Bassnano), which was truly fantastic. Both about same price at 90 EUR for 2. Would probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: harjill
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at Hotel Bassano and it was wonderful. We were upgraded to a suite which was an unexpected surprise. Other reviews have pointed out most of the highlights. The hotel was clean, well kept and comfortable. The staff were excellent, efficient and helpful, especially arranging tours etc. There is a delightful patisserie about 4 doors down from the hotel. It opens at 7:15 a.m. and a great place to get breakfast. Also a great restaurant at 11 rue Jean Giraudoux called ilana is excellent and reasonable. It's about 2 minutes walk from hotel. Great location, 5 minutes from George V Metro and Champs Elysees. 10 minutes to the Seine and Eiffel Tower. It is a 4 star hotel and I would highly recommend it. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good all-around hotel”
Reviews.Author: TxGoldwing
Reviews.Content: We were hoping to stay in a 5-star hotel in Paris but none were available at the time we were visiting. After reading positive reviews of Bassano on TripAdvisor, we booked a room there. The hotel is rated as 4 star and I think that is probably a fair evaluation. While the property is small, the Superior Room we received as fairly large and well appointed. The mattress was too low to the ground and was ready to be replaced. It was very hard and not too comfortable. The bathroom was marble and large as well with excellent L'Ocittane amenities. The hotel's staff is a real high point. They were very pleasant and helpful with directions or any other assistance we required. Everyone speaks good English and is easy to deal with. They even modified our reservation from a "package" deal to a Superior Room only (no included Internet and breakfast). I had read that the breakfast at the hotel was not as good as can be had at the Boulangerie right next door. That info was spot on. We saved 30 Euro a night by not eating breakfast at the hotel. The hotel has free wireless Internet in the lobby, so we did not need the 8 Euro per day wi-fi in the room. Notwithstanding the discomfort delivered by the rock-hard bed, the hotel was clean, quiet and a good value. If we were looking for a 4 star hotel in Paris, we would certainly stay there again. The property is also in a good location, only minutes from Eiffel Tower, Champs Elysees and Arc d' Triomphe.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the hype”
Reviews.Author: rednblackexile
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is as good as the majority of reviews suggest. Clean, comfortable, well located, quiet, helpful staff (a request for an iron and ironing board at 11pm was met within 5 minutes). Room not vast but with lots of goodies, and the personal note from the manager was a nice touch. And with a bathroom and (seperate!) toilet, both with opening windows - I think this must be a first. We had a superior room, so cannot comment on the standard ones. Booked the day before direct with the hotel, we had a decent rate, although it was August. We always rely on trip advisor for city centre hotels, and this one did not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Family-from-USA
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4. We chose this hotel based on the reviews from Trip Advisor. Our suite was excellent and quite. Nice large bath room (relative to european hotels). 5 Minute walk to Champs-Elysee and close to George V metro. Reasonably priced for a suite. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. Would stay there again. This is our 4th vacation planned using Trip Advisor - Paris, London, Phoenix, Las Vegas and Italy. The reviews are right on. Thank You for the fellow travellers and Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at the Bassano”
Reviews.Author: OneStreet
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Paris on business. The staff was probably the best I have encountered any where. They were friendly and helpful. Before we arrived they had coordinated a car rental for us with the office. Rooms were tight, but very gracious and certainly well appointed. Would stay there again in a heartbeat. Thank you for the wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place.. nice staff... tiny touches”
Reviews.Author: travlrsw-4kids
Reviews.Content: We got a last minute hotel room at the Bassano when we decided to head to Paris for Bastille Day. I spent hours looking at review but none seemed to meet us... we are family with 4, YES 4!! Young children. We only needed one room since our kids are young, we were worried as we read how small Paris hotel rooms are. After much research we choose the Bassano and we weren't disappointed. No, it is no luxuery American hotel, but it is classey, and Parisian and the staff was extreamley friendly to us... even tried to help me find a Starbucks by calling them, twice! We went for the Superior room so that we could have the extra floor space. It was tight.. but we managed to put all 4 of kids on the floor (one in a baby bed). There was PLENY of closet space, the bathroom was very large and the tub/ shower fit us fine. We had romantic flower petals in the bathroom when we checked in, and when we returned home from a long night, we were surprised to find our room picked up and beds turned down... complete with little chocolates! (Even in the baby bed!) The air conditioner was WONDERFUL in the Paris heat, and although our view was of other buildings, it was fun to watch all the going on's below. (And the bells chiming at the church nearby were lovely to listen to.) We found ourselves wishing we were on a romantic trip, however it was VERY kid-friendly and large family friendly. We will go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Bassano!”
Reviews.Author: YoungTravelersUsa
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Bassano on our first journey to Paris together. Our decision to stay here was based on Trip Advisor and we weren't let down in the least! This is definitely a four-star hotel within a few blocks of the Champs-Elysee. The bed was big and comfortable and the room is very spacious. The bathroom we had was huge with a big, overflowing bathtub. The bath products are all L'Occitane and very luxurious. We took a bath up on our arrival. The food is good; however, breakfast is not complimentary as it was at some of the hotels we stayed at in Italy (we loved that touch about those places). However, the staff is friendly and accomodating to your requests. We truly enjoyed our visit here!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mel72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the weekend of the 6th July. This hotel was fantastic. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, going out of their way to make your stay a pleasant one. We had a superior room which was very large and very clean, with a lovely large immaculately clean bathroom. Linens and towels were changed daily. Fluffy bathrobes and slippers provided, and L'Occitane shower gel, shampoo, soap and body lotion provided which was a nice touch. In room tea and coffee, comfortable beds, small plasma TV, and the room was immaculate. In all the hotel had provided everything to make the stay pleasant - I've stayed in five star hotels which aren't as great as this! Breakfast was lovely and good value. In all a wonderful stay, and I would definitely want to stay at this hotel again if I returned to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sctraveler94
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderfull little hotel in the heart of a great area in Paris. The Arc De Triomphe is only a few blocks away, as is access to the Metro. The hotel employees are extremely nice and accomodating, and the rooms were impecabbly neat and well cared for. We had adjoining rooms for our family of four and were very surprised at how much space we had, including the two separate bathrooms. The cost was very reasonable and from the significant shopping I did on the internet (thanks to TripAdvisor.com!) this is by far one of the best deals in the city. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We were truly delighted!”
Reviews.Author: Isaac36
Reviews.Content: We booked two adjoining rooms to accommodate our 7 & 8 year olds and they loved it too. The rooms were very comfortable and the service was extremely friendly. The icing on the cake was the location - a short walk from the Champs-Elysees and a few minutes from the Eiffel Tower (even our kids managed it without too many complaints!). Well worth its 4* rating.

Reviews.Title: “An introduction to Paris”
Reviews.Author: LuckyTravellerSurrey
Reviews.Content: We decided to take our two girls ages 8 & 10 to Paris for a few days and booked Hotel Bassano on the basis of Trip Advisor reviews. We were more than happy with our choice. The hotel is ideally located just off the Champs-Elysees and the staff were really friendly and helpful. The beds were comfortable, rooms quiet, towels white and fluffy and the complimentary toiletries were lovely. Breakfast, whilst a bit pricey, was delicious and there was plenty of choice - sausages and bacon, cereals, pastries, yoghurt, fresh fruit and plenty of good coffee. The girls loved their hot chocolate and we were offered a complimentary glass of champagne one morning! Only one small issue. Having asked for adjacent or interconnecting rooms when booking, we were bemused to find we'd been given adjacent rooms with one of the rooms being part of an interconnecting pair. However the hotel very quickly agreed to swap us into the interconnecting pair and this worked beautifully as we could lock the outer door and freely walk between both rooms. Just not sure why they didnt put us in there straight away. All in all a great trip and hopefully the first of many visits for our children.

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Wanted”
Reviews.Author: SBandRMB
Reviews.Content: We booked a long weekend 15th June to 18th June 2007 to celebrate my wifes 40th birthday. There are are so many to choose from but Hotel Bassano appeared to meet our requirements. The comments turned out to be very accurate and Hotel Bassano was everything we were looking for. Staff extremely helpful and polite at all times. Hotel well decorated and spotlessly clean everywhere. We were upgraded free of charge to superior and the bedroom was a good size, with seperate WC and a very spacious bathroom. Housekeeping was faultless with fresh linen and towels, soaps and shampoos replaced automatically and the bathroom and toilet gleamed. Continental breakfast gave ample choice to get you going for the day. Hotel good central location and Champs-Elysees about 5 minutes steady walk. Seine about 8 minutes walk (Batueaux Mouche dock) and Eiffel Tower 20 minutes. We e-mailed the hotel direct and they booked tours for us in advance.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pronovias
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from this hotel after the long weekend. The hotel was located in a lovely quite area. The staff were very friendly and efficient. Our hotel rooms were nice and clean and the l'occitane products in the bathroom were a nice added touch. Breakfast was very reasonable at only 12 euros. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would return there again however i am not sure i would rate this hotel four star more like three star.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service in a Central Location”
Reviews.Author: TOD_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bassano has the most considerate and obliging staff I have met on any holidays I have been on. I stayed in Paris for a short break over the June weekend and I must say that all of these reviews on tripadvisor have been spot on. Hotel Bassano is situated about 3 mins walk from the Champs-Élysées and about 6 to 10 mins walk to the Eiffel Tower. The rooms were always clean and you were never hunted out of your room for cleaning like in other hotels. It was cleaned when you were gone and when you came back at night time the beds were turned down. I thought there was a great deal of little touches such as the L'Occitane shower gels and freshing towels, that just made that little bit of difference. Last but not least , I must say my thanks to the staff. From the minute we arrived they were nothing but kind, considerate and are willing to help all the time. I will definitely stay here again on my return trip to Paris. Keep it up Hotel Bassano because it's nice to get proper hotel service for change.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Kardoula3
Reviews.Content: Even though the Hotel Bassano is a lovely, historic old building, the best part of the place is the staff. Every person we encountered, working at this hotel, was pleasant, warm and very helpful. The room was a tad bit shabby for a 4-Star Hotel (just my opinion) but the fantastic location, the lovely lobby and the amazingly friendly and helpful staff, really make it a wonderful place to be. I have stayed in 5-Star hotels that couldn't even begin to compare their staff to the Bassano! By the way, it was also spotlessly clean and the maids appeared to be always there because, regardless of whether we slept super late or left early, when we returned, the room was always cleaned beautifully. By the way, try a massage that's given at their 'sister hotel' (just down the street)...it was in temple-like atmosphere and you feel like you REALLY had a vacation afterwards. My husband and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Best People!”
Reviews.Author: jpnfun
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Bassano for business in the beginning of May. The staff was great and so was the location. The service was professional. The staff was more than helpful. The only issue is the price of the wireless internet. If you are a business traveller, be ready to pay a good amount (but that is almost anywhere in Europe).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JohnBerg
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 adjoining rooms for 2 adults and 2 children. This was the final part of our European trip following stays in London, Amsterdam, Venice & Rome. We had never been to Paris before so the location was excellent, easy to walk to Champs Elysses, cafes, ATMs etc and bus stops. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms we had were surprisingly spacious and we felt we received good value for money

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: miranjelica
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I stayed at the Hotel Residence Bassano from April 14 to 22, 2007. It is a wonderful hotel, made more so by the staff than anything. I had booked the hotel based on reviews from Trip Advisor. It's nicely located near the main streets, and in the middle of the so-called Golden Triangle of Paris. I had booked early last July 2006, and had been in communication with the hotel regarding airport transfers and religious services (as a Catholic, I wanted to know of any nearby churches). The hotel staff, namely Gaelle, Hoa, Ali and Anita, were always up to date and aware of our arrangements. When I arrived, the lift was being repaired, but Saran, the bellhop, kindly lugged my extremely large bag up the steps (up to the 3rd floor, for which I was very grateful!) without complaint. In other places, you'd be hearing quite an earful by then. During our stay, Antoine was on duty at the desk and he was most obliging in helping us confirm our flights, arranging for our taxi, etc. They were all very helpful and friendly, and we appreciated it very much! The hotel is simply but charmingly furnished. The bedsheets were always clean and tidy and a pleasure to sleep in. We had been upgraded to a larger room at no extra cost and throughout our stay, experienced a blissful quiet. We hardly heard or saw anyone, and only during breakfast, if at all. Breakfast is expensive at 18 Euros for the full buffet, but since I was pretty hungry at the time I tried it, it was worth it. Room service is also available, though at certain times only. The food was excellent and arrived at their proper temperatures. If you like quiet neighborhoods (this isn't like St. Germain de Pres where it's chock full of tourists; most of the residents were like us, there primarily on business), then the Hotel Bassano is for you. The Champs Elysees is a few blocks down (literally downhill), and at the end of the street is the very large Loius Vuitton flagship store. If you need a taxi, the hotel staff is eager to help, or if you want to walk a bit, go down Avenue Marceau, there's a reliable stand there, in front of the other property the Bassano is affiliated with, the Hotel Elysees Regencia. The nearest Metro stop is at Kleber on Avenue Kleber, which we used a lot, but if you want to be at the center of things, the George V station is not a bad walk to the Champs Elysees where it's located. I certainly recommend this hotel, great value for money and wonderful hospitality, too, in a city with a reputation for rudeness that in this case is quite undeserved.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: edendown
Reviews.Content: We have just enjoyed our first stay in Paris, compliments of our daughters, and the Hotel Bassano made the trip a total success. The staff are the most friendly, helpful and professional people we have stayed with in all of our international travel. The hotel is peaceful, immaculately clean and in a perfect location for access to the fabulous sites Paris has to offer. While we were there they offered breakfast, served in the bar area, which provided a very pleasant environment to enjoy fresh continental breakfast, as well as a cooked alternative of bacon, sausage and scrambled eggs. Our suite, on the first floor, was spacious, clean and silent. The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed we have experienced. There is no doubt that, when we return to Paris, we will stay at the Bassano again and have no hesitation, whatsoever, in recommending this hotel to anyone wanting the convenience of a central Paris location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Praxus
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel about a 3 minute walk from the champ elysees and the nearest metro station; and perhaps a 15 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. Its on a pretty quiet sidestreet. The rooms were all renovated in 2006 and they look great. I was very impressed by the attitude and service of the front desk staff. All front desk staff at every hotel should be like them! Personally I generally prefer to stay on the left bank; but if I was going to stay on the right bank I would book this hotel again in a heartbeat. Excellent hotel and worth all the raves on this site.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: cleo88
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay. Welcoming staff. Quiet hotel not far from the Champs Elysees. Rooms clean and facilities good. Would definately recommend this hotel for a stay in Paris. Stayed in London in Nov 06 and hotel was not at all on par with this little gem and was the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and cozy with an incredible concierge team!”
Reviews.Author: cravingtravel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bassano is a great little hotel just blocks off of the Champs-Elysees. The concierge offered a very warm welcome and were most accomodating when I arrived early. While I waited for my room, I was given a glass of water served on a tray and invited to use the internet. My room was very clean and cozy with Parisian decor (it was nice to have L'Occitane toiletries too). The concierge (especially Hoa and Aline) were very helpful when I was planning my days (they would write addresses down for me if I had a difficult time with the pronounciation or try to make a reservation for me). Traveling solo, it was nice to know that I could ask them for assistance should need be and suggestions. Very impressive! Overall, I will definitely return when I go back with my fiance at some point. I've rated it 4 stars because it was approximately 5 blocks off of the Champs and at night, it was quite a quiet walk returning to the hotel which wouldn't be a big deal if you were with another person but for one, the walk made me a little nervous. The quiet was wonderful for sleeping and a little respite in this bustling city. Definitely will recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good”
Reviews.Author: EimearDublin
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a fantastic location, just 5mins walk from the george v metro stop. The reception staff are very helpful and welcoming. The room was very nice and clean but I don't like the seperate toilet and shower rooms. The toiletries are beautiful. The breakfast is really good, with a good selection of food. The coffee wasn't fantastic and the waiter serving us not very friendly. All in all, it is a very good hotel, we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: nachema
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing and romantic first trip to Paris and a lot of it was because we stayed at such a nice hotel. I wanted a good location and a comfortable room and was very impressed with everything from the gracious service to the beautiful room (upgraded to a suite for free!). We almost canceled our trip due to other problems but when we finally made it to Paris and saw our room we wanted to stay for longer than we had planned. I chose this hotel based on the reviews I read here and crosssed my fingers, hoping for the best. Hotel Bassano exceeded those hopes. The suite was beautifully decorated and spacious, the bathroom was modern and immaculate and breakfast was very nice. I didn't notice any traffic noise but I'm used to a good deal of city noise at home. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bassano is great!”
Reviews.Author: dfur
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, 5 minutes walk from George V metro stop on Champs-Elysses. Staff were extremely helpful and obliging e.g. booked restaurants, taxis etc for us (our French not being up to standard to do this ourselves!) We had a superior double room, it was always clean with fresh towels provided everyday. Bed was soft and big and the room was a good size, not small at all. There is a little supermarket on the street opposite the hotel to buy cheap bottled water too. Couldn't comment on the food as never ate at the hotel. Really no complaints at all, would definitely stay there again. A little going away present by L'Occtaine from the hotel is a lovely touch!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Sophisticated Charm”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkSolo
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is located on a quiet street, which belies its proximity to the Champs Elysee. The room was attractive, the staff friendly and helpful, the room service prompt and very good. I stayed 6 nights and did not have a single complaint. As a bonus, there are surprises like an offer of a glass of champagne to accompany a leisurely breakfast and a small gift on departure.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: BeenHereBeenThere
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in the last week in Febuary. Not the best time to visit Paris, but we lucked out as the weather was unseasonably nice. We booked a Standard Room and, liked most of the posts here, we were upgraded to a Superior Room at no additional cost (Room 32). The room was beautiful and spacious and the staff was extremely courteous and helpful. All of the staff we met spoke very good English, which was good as my French is horrible. The room was cleaned daily very well and the turndown service made my wife feel like a queen. The in room safe was large enough for out laptop (15.4" wide screen) and all of our other valuables. The TV does get 4 english speaking cable channels. 2 news channels, BBC One and a EuroSports which is in german some of the time. Also has a XXX channel late at night, so be careful of any children you bring. The room also had a HUGE closet large enough to unpack our 3 suitcases into. The location was unbeatable. It was an extremely quiet neighborhood being a couple of blocks off any main streets and within walking distance to just about everything. We even walked to the Louvre and Notre Dame, although it was an extremely long walk and not for the weak at heart. The Metro was easily accessible for those wishing to use it. They were typically crowded but great for getting around and a heck of a lot cheaper than a taxi. Food-wise, we found 2 very good Italian restaurants within walking distance, a pastry shop 2 doors down from the hotel which we used daily and a cute little market a couple of blocks up towards the Arc on Avenue Marceau which always had fresh fruit (best grapes I ever had). Complaints? Only that the toilet area, which is separate from the bathroom was a bit small so I would not recommend it for anyone that is claustrophobic. Definately the best place we ever heard of or found in Paris. We stayed at 2 other hotels this trip, including a 4 star (Le Meridian), and this one outshined them easily. WARNING: Paris is EXTREMELY expensive especially with the dollar to euro rates being upsidedown. It was just ranked the second most expensive city in the world by CNNMoney. Rachel Ray did a "$40 a day" in Paris in 2002, but I dare her to do it again now that the conversion rate is the other way around.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rferris
Reviews.Content: Very good service and central location where you can explore common sites. Clean rooms, friendly staff. With the high exchange rate, it is expensive for Americans - but probably worth the price. My wife was happy, so that is most all that matters!

Reviews.Title: “A welcome retreat from the Paris crowds!”
Reviews.Author: traimartin
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic weekend at the Hotel Bassano. We arrived early morning in Paris and, even though check in time isn’t officially until 2pm, the Hotel staff went out of their way to provide us with a room within 20 minutes. Whilst waiting, we were given free coffee. We were also upgraded to a superior room at no extra cost. The Hotel is in a quiet street situated off the Champs Elysee and very central to the major Paris attractions. The Arc de Triomphe, Eiffel Tower and the Louvre are all within walking distance. Our room was beautifully decorated, clean and a great place to come back to at the end of a full day battling the Paris crowds. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Warmmmmly welcoming”
Reviews.Author: golfer83
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this superbly positioned hotel, only a short walk from the Champs Elysees and the Arc de Triomphe. Our room was large, comfortable and quiet and we had a sizeable well-equipped bathroom with plenty of little goodies to help with the toilette. Most importantly, however, the staff were unfailingly helpful, always providing us with what we wamted and always with a smile. Their attentive service will stay in our minds as a contributor to a very pleasant week's holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ernie_Bilko
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend break. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Room also very good. Location excellent and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: njo69
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location and very comfortable accomodation, the service and advice was spot on, wouldnt hesitate to book again.

Reviews.Title: “gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: taxmanmrwilson
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely privately owned hotel in a fantastic location--- only 5 minutes walk from the Champs Elysees and 10 minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower. My family and I stayed in a suite and found this to be a great base for exploring Paris. The staff are friendly and courteous. Breakfast is well done and presented. There is free internet access which is helpful. All in all we would defintely recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, peaceful hotel”
Reviews.Author: JasmineLManchester
Reviews.Content: 2nd visit to Paris. First time we stayed at The Novotel which was too large & very businesslike. We really enjoyed the position of Hotel Bassano in a typical, quiet part of Paris - a much more romantic setting. The staff are very polite & willing to please. We found the room delightful & very comfortable (it was much appreciated when we went out for the evening to find our bed had been turned back & chocolates left for us - a very nice touch). Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: KDO
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for just one night but I will definitely be back. The hotel is very well situated, small but cosy, spotlessly clean. Most importantly the staff were so friendly and helpful. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a suite which was really appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bassarno”
Reviews.Author: David_GG
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights, the Hotel Staff were very friendly and at all times helpful. We are very well travelled, therefore we are in a position to make a well informed recommendation. The Hotel is clean, well furnished with good facillities. The hotel is a couple of minutes from the Metro (George V) and minutes on the Metro to all the major visitor sites. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: AH_HF_W
Reviews.Content: Family with three children Great hotel on a quiet street only minutes walk from the Champs d'Elysee, the Arc de Triumph and a pleasant 10 minutes from the Eiffel Tower. Close to the metro station on the Champs d'Elysee. Our suite was a decent size and well presented, the bathroom had a very large tub and excellent power shower which after a long days sightseeing was very agreeable. Robes, towels and toiletries excellent. Staff were always polite and helpful. We had a wonderful stay and will definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: DebMichael
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a weekend trip to paris and stayed at the Hotel Bassano. The location is great, close (5 min walk) to the arc de triomphe/champs eleyses and the george V metro station. We stayed in a superior room which was well equipped but in some areas a little worn. The maid service was wonderful with the bed made and turned down every night. (The chocolates were lovely). The staff at the hotel were very very friendly. They always had a smile on their faces and couldn't do enough for you. They recommended an italian restaurant to us, called Findi, which was fabulous and not expensive. 30 euros for a 3 course meal and free champagne. When we go back to paris we will defintaly go back to this very charming hotel. Internet access was free.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: uoip
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel partly on the basis of tripadvisor reviews and have got to say I was very disappointed. The fifth floor "superior" room was cramped, stuffy, with dated decor and two single beds pushed together to make a double. The hot water did not work properly and we had to boil several kettles to run a hot bath. For 280 euros a night (not including breakfast) it was bordering on ridiculous. Overpriced and not recommended

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: brandall
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped into the Hotel Bassano, the staff were almost embarrassingly friendly! Nothing was too much trouble and they even changed our room at the last minute. The room was lovely without being over lavish, with a huge bathroom and separate toilet, and it was very clean, quiet and private. The hotel is in a perfect position for sight seeing, and the Rue Bassano is very quiet, so you get the best of both worlds. There were planty of great restaurants within easy walking distance, so no cabs needed and when we wanted to go further afield, the hotel staff were very helpful in making reservations and recommendations. We will definatley be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great, friendly little hotel”
Reviews.Author: runtom
Reviews.Content: Quiet, 5 story, 32 room, hotel with tiny slow elevator. "King Sized" bed was wide but only the length of a standard bed. I'm 5' 10" and my feet hung over a bit, so tall people beware! Staff was friendly, helpful, efficient and spoke reasonably good English. Room was larger than we expected with lots of storage space. Presence of an entry hall provided an even more spacious feel. Unusual hair dryer with hose and head resembling a vacuum cleaner had insufficient drying power. Shower was awkward to use, but the large bath towels were nice and soft. Short phone calls to the US were affordable at 0.35 Euros/min. Laptop computer off lobby provided free internet access, but the European keyboard was difficult for me to use. Breakfast was good, but a bit expensive at 12 Euros for continental and 18 Euros for full breakfast. We were unable to locate cafes serving full breakfast in the area. Location was close to Champs Elysses but somewhat remote from Louvre and Notre Dame

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: DDouglasF
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice three-night stay here in late September. The room was very comfortable and quiet. We didn’t’ hear any noise from the street or from the other rooms. The air conditioning worked fine on a warm afternoon. The décor was tasteful and the storage was adequate. The bathroom, while well equipped, was small even by Paris standards. Having stayed at the Hotel San Gregoire (6th) at the beginning of our trip, we had been spoiled by a larger bathroom. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The neighborhood was safe and a brief walk from the Champs Elysees and the Metro. We didn’t try the breakfast, but there were a number of cafes close by. I would highly recommend this hotel for people wanting to stay on the Right Bank and close to the Champs Elysees. We tried three restaurants during our stay here with mixed results. We had a great time at the L’Angle du Faubourg (the second line restaurant of the three star Taillevent), which is a brisk 15-minute walk from the hotel. The food, the service, and the atmosphere were all top notch. They have a great 35 Euro menu at dinner, but you have to ask for it. It is posted outside, but the printed menu presented at table mentions only the 70 Euro menu and the expensive a la carte. The less expensive pre-fix menu is three courses and well worth asking for. Our impressions of the other restaurants we tried were mixed. The Citrus Etoile near the Arc de Triomphe was like being at home-California cuisine. The chef here had done a ten-year stint in southern California. The place is lots of fun and the chef’s US-born wife, a former model, runs the dining room. The first course of smoked Scottish salmon was out of this world, but the main course of roasted salmon was less appealing. Maybe it was too hard an act to follow after the wonderful first course or maybe I had too much salmon. The dessert of fresh sorbets was very good. I recommend going here because of the smoked salmon, a good wine list (2004 Domaine Laroche Chablis for 30 Euro), the pleasant atmosphere and the caring service. The lighter touch on the food might be an interesting change if one has been dining on richer, more traditional cuisine. The third night we dined at Flora, a five-minute walk from the hotel. The experience here was bizarre. We arrived on time for our 9:00 P.M. reservation, but it took an hour to get any food. The staff seemed overwhelmed by the packed restaurant. The first course, a fish soup, was tasty, but things went downhill from there. We had been tempted by the menu description of a fresh swordfish brochette. However, when the meal arrived, we found an over-cooked piece of fish that had been coated with not very interesting spices with a skewer stuck through it. My wife could not finish her meal. The waitress inquired as to why she didn’t finish her meal. To our regret, we told her that the fish was dried out. The waitress immediately picked up the plate, took my wife’s fork and began mashing the leftover fish into a mushy paste. From then on, we were practically ignored. Our dessert was brought in silence and we never offered coffee. At the end of the meal the chef came out and greeted each table. If my French had been better, I would have tried to complain. At that point, we just wanted to leave. I had to retrieve our coats from the cloak closet, as none of the staff was around to help. I strongly suggest you avoid Flora.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: London-lover-forever
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! I was really impressed with my stay at the Bassano. The check in was quick and easy and we were upgraded to a superior room, which was a nice surprise! The room was clean and cosy with a lovely marble bathroom. It is in an ideal location and the staff were very helpful in giving information about local attractions and places to eat etc. I would definitely stay here again, a good value for money and a comfortable stay at the Bassano!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: warthog1001
Reviews.Content: Well-placed just off the Champs Elysees, clean and friendly with very nice rooms. The family suite of two adjoining rooms was ideal for our two children.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pascal G
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very good if you are looking for something well priced for the location. It is only 5 min walk from the champs Elysees!! However if you want something with a little bit more class, it isn't the right hotel. Rooms are spacious but a bit dated (but clean). I was really impressed with the hotel in general but I was looking for something more classy. So I would only recommend the place for people who are looking for somewhere where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “I like it but couldn't contact with anyone : (”
Reviews.Author: gar01
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel but I can't believe that they charge you for the internet access! That's so old-fashioned

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dante08
Reviews.Content: What can you say about a clean room at a great location. The staff was very helpful and attentive.I don't know if you can do better...

Reviews.Title: “Just Fantastic!! C'est Formidable!!”
Reviews.Author: Lunaghsa
Reviews.Content: To put this in perspective, my new husband, my son and my brother and girlfriend arrived in Hotel Bassano straight from a superior room in Disneyland Hotel. This little hotel therefore had a lot to live up to. And it did. And how! We were given an early check in to our suite. I'm not telling you the room number since I want to try as much as possible to ensure that it is available when we want to go back! Our suite had a bedroom, a sitting room with a fold out double sofa bed and a kitchenette with a fridge. Not a mini bar, although it served that purpose as well but a fridge. As a mother travelling with her son, this was the icing on the cake. I could wash bubba's bottles and store his milk and food hygienically which is more than I can say for the Disneyland Hotel. There was a huge bathroom and a separate toilet, clever people! Our bed was scattered with flower petals when we arrived. We ooh-ed and aah-ed over the rooms and went out. 5 minutes later saw us posing in front of the Arc de Triomphe following a leisurely stroll down Champs Elyssee. The location is perfect for sightseeing and aimless wandering around the heart of Paris. The staff are the best I have found anywhere. They cannot do enough for their guests. They all speak great English which is just as well as my schoolgirl French was a little embarrassing! To any future guests, be careful which hotel you book as there are two hotel Bassanos directly across from each other. Since I haven't stayed in the other one I’m not going to comment on it but this review is about the 4 star one at 15 rue de Bassano. I could write about this hotel forever. In the same fortnight we had stayed in the Waldorf Astoria in New York and as mentioned, Disneyland Hotel and in a nutshell this hotel wipes the floor with both of them. Give yourself a present and stay here. It's now joined my list of 'Reasons to go to Paris'! I will post pictures later but can confirm that unlike other hotel websites, what you see on the hotel Bassano website is exactly what you get. And more..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: SomewhereThere
Reviews.Content: We have booked this hotel based on other reviews on Trip Advisor. This was the only hotel with nothing negative in the reviews. It also provided accomodations for four people which was what we were looking for. Extremely clean, spacious rooms with beautiful decor, very nice marble bathrooms with bathroom robes. The staff was very friendly, helpful and always there for you to answer any questions or to book any restaurant. Breakfast was lovely (it was included in our price) and served in a nice breakfast area. I just cannot find anything bad to say. Big windows opened to a very quiet small street. The metro station was a short walk (right on Champs Elysees). Great restaurants nearby, "Asian" is a must. Very friendly service and amazing food. I highly recommend the hotel and the restaurant.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Bassano
HotelInfo.Address: 15, rue de Bassano | 16 Arr., 75116 Paris, France
